abstract: British Labour Party's shadow chancellor of the Exchequer John McDonnell gives speech at party's annual conference outlining his economic policies; hopes to show party is not moving too far leftward, with promises to address deficit and engage outside experts' advice, while appeasing his hard left supporters with opposition to austerity.
lead_paragraph: John McDonnell, Labour’s newly appointed shadow chancellor of the Exchequer, moved to calm fears that the party would turn away from centrist economic policies of the past.

headline.main: British Labour Party, Wary of Old Image, Puts Its Focus on Prudence
headline.print_headline: Labour, Wary of Old Image, Puts Its Focus on Prudence

snippet: John McDonnell, Labour’s newly appointed shadow chancellor of the Exchequer, moved to calm fears that the party would turn away from centrist economic policies of the past.
